name: Dunk, Appellant, v. Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission
name_abbreviation: Dunk v. Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
parties: Dunk, Appellant, v. Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The petition for allowance of appeal is granted. The order of the Superior Court affirming the order of the Public Utility Commission is vacated and the record remitted to the Superior Court for reargument and opinion.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Christian V. Graff, with him John E. Fullerton, for appellants.
Anthony L. Marino, Assistant Counsel, with him Joseph C. Bruno, Chief Counsel, for Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission, appellee.
Samuel Graff Miller, with him Donald Blanlten and Edwin W. Scott, for Philadelphia Electric Company, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:

Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Christian V. Graff, with him John E. Fullerton, for appellants.
Anthony L. Marino, Assistant Counsel, with him Joseph C. Bruno, Chief Counsel, for Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission, appellee.
Samuel Graff Miller, with him Donald Blanlten and Edwin W. Scott, for Philadelphia Electric Company, appellee.
February 6, 1967:
